description: Ever since it opened in 1978, shoppers have been dazzled by the caliber of the fine antiques and jewellery found at this elegant, well-stocked store. Featuring everything from vintage engagement rings, estate jewelry to rare collectibles.

reviews.title: Great experience
text: We were very happy with our meeting with Cynthia. She was able to find just what we wanted in an Art Deco necklace. This is our second time purchasing jewellery with Cynthia and can't recommend her highly enough!

reviews.title: a treasure trove of fine collectibles and unusual finds
text: This place is PACKED with antique and vintage fine china, silver, collectibles, jewelry, crystal, paintings, small furnishings.  Really, it's almost too full.  DO NOT bring your young children, make sure you carry your purse or back pack, and don't wear swinging coats, you WILL hit something!! The staff are very knowledgeable about their patterns and their stock, and willing to help when they can.  The vintage fine jewelry is beautiful, a lovely variety of gemstones, settings, metals.

reviews.title: Junk Gyspy Clan
text: Nice antiques if you like and look for glass. They have lots and lots of glass. Great place to look for missing pieces for sets.

reviews.title: Cynthia Findlay was amazing!
text: Myself and my (now) Fiancé went into Cynthia Findlay in October 2017 to look for an engagement ring. The staff were very friendly and listened carefully to what I was asking for, showing me any rings I wanted to try on and making suggestions based on my preferences. I found one that I absolutely loved, but it was significantly over my budget. Cynthia was so kind and accommodating, and assured me that she could have a replica ring made of the one that I loved within my budget. After I made a few small changes (ie: gold colour), we left and booked a follow up appointment to look at diamonds. During the follow-up appointment I really felt that Cynthia understood exactly what I was looking for, and I left everything in her hands, knowing that I could fully trust her with the whole process, and I didn't need to consult with her again. My fiancé pick up the ring in Dec 2018. I cannot stress enough that the ring is even better than I expected, Cynthia went above and beyond our expectations, and we are so happy we chose her to make my dream ring. I HIGHLY recommend going to Cynthia Findlay!

reviews.title: Great spot!
text: Bought an engagement ring here. Excellent and patient service from knowledgeable staff. Very glad they made the experience so seamless.
Incredible collection of antiques that I didn't have time to check out.

reviews.title: Emerald engagement!
text: I found Cynthia Findlay antiques via google while searching for an emerald engagement ring- I was having a hard time finding them anywhere else and I just wanted to see them, maybe try a couple on to get an idea of what it would look like on my hand and which cut would be best.
My boyfriend (now fiancé) went in together and Christine was very patient with us, and very knowledgeable. We looked at many many emerald ring and I must have tried on a dozen or so.
I went back in with a friend in August because I saw some other ones that I hadn't tried on- Christine recognized me and, again, devoted her time to my questions.
To my surprise, my boyfriend went in the same day and purchased the ring of my dreams! He had an amazing experience with both Cynthia and Christine.
I cannot not thank them both enough for helping us! We are extremely happy and confident in our purchase- thank you!!

reviews.title: Terrible experience through and through
text: Unequivocally bad experience.

Drove 4 hours to come here because I saw an amazing engagement ring on their website. Paid an arm and a leg for it, and they wanted to charge us to resize it, AND charge us for shipping it. My husband ended up being able to talk them into sizing it for us, and shipping for a smaller fee. There was one staff member who helped us through the process who was lovely, but then Cynthia came over, and the experience took an absolute nosedive. What a rude and unaccommodating woman, we were about to spend over 5k on a ring, and she had the audacity to be rude to my husband, followed by an even worse comment towards me. Gave us a sob story about the man who made the ring (its new, supposedly handmade, with a ‘vintage look’). Made another rude comment, I almost walked out. I fell in love with the ring, I was not about to leave without it. So we paid, got the receipt and appraisal as quickly as possible, and left before something worse could happen.

Not 48 hours after having my ring sized and back on my finger, a diamond fell out! Our engagement photos were scheduled for the week after, and we called Cynthia in a panic. They offered to replace the diamond and ship back for free. Thank god. The ring setting is platinum, so why a diamond fell out so quickly is beyond me. They blamed it on the sizing, but the setting sits above the band, and would not be affected by the sizing at all. Communication from the store throughout this process was severely lacking.

Fast forward a few months later, another diamond falls out. Called Cynthia, an employee fed us a line about “used jewelry being delicate” ....IT IS NEW!! And platinum should not be delicate. They hung up quickly after saying they wouldn’t do anything about it.

We brought the ring to our usual jeweller to be fixed. The jeweller said the ring was NOT platinum, the appraisal we were given by Cynthia was inflated by at least 200%, and the centre sapphire stone was was low quality - it has scratched and chipped already.
So needless to say, not only was this experience stressful, but we got ripped off. Hard.
Cynthia Findlay and team should be embarrassed. Absolutely disgraceful, I’ve honestly never had a worse experience.

reviews.title: Just didn't feel welcomed at all. Way over priced common stuff. You may find it at other places 1/10th of these prices d
text: Just didn't feel welcomed at all. They way too busy chatting. Ridiculously over priced common stuff. You may find them at other antique places at 1/10th of these incredibly stupid prices. Was nice to see all these floor to ceiling jammed in stuff sitting there for years after years!

reviews.title: Excellent and knowledgable service
text: My fiancé and I went to Cynthia Findley's to pick out my ring together. Katherine helped us, and she was extremely friendly and knowledgable. She let us try on a million rings and take all the time we needed to make the decision. She also guided us through the process, helping us figure out what we wanted and to narrow done the rings.
There is a very good selection of vintage and antique rings at the store (there are some new as well though - so if you're looking for an older ring make sure to say!).

Cynthia herself was also very knowledgable and helpful. The first resizing was still a bit too small, and they kindly did the second resizing at no extra cost. Also, besides jewelry, there is just a lot of great stuff to look at there - well worth a visit!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience all-around!
text: My fiance purchased my engagement ring at Cynthia Findlay Antiques, and he was so impressed by how knowledgeable, kind, and helpful Cynthia was that he wanted me to go back to meet her. We went together 2 weeks later and she helped me size my ring, and also took a couple of sweet impromptu engagement photos of us, which we received via email the next day. The ring is beautiful and the shop is fascinating, full of lots of different antiques. Highly recommended, whether you are seeking a perfect engagement ring with lots of character, or looking for other wonderful antiques.

reviews.title: Excellent experience purchasing gorgeous vintage engagement ring
text: I had an incredible experience purchasing my engagement ring through Cynthia Findlay antique. Catherine, the associate who helped with the ring selection process immediately felt like a friend and was very patient as I tried on nearly everything in the store. Cynthia was also lovely and told me about the history and details of my ring. They also went above and beyond what was required and put a rush on the resizing and reshanking of the ring and sent out someone early to pick it up so that my fiancee could get the ring in time for when he wanted to propose. Can not recommend them highly enough! Great selection of estate jewellery and exceptional customer service.

reviews.title: Absolute gem of a shop!
text: My fiancé chose my ring at Cynthia Findlay, and I could never have hoped for a better ring! He visited the store on his own on numerous occasions where the staff patiently helped him narrow the selection down to my perfect ring! He couldn't believe the amazing selection or the fantastic value for beautiful estate pieces. He was never rushed and really valued the team's honest opinions on what would suit.

Cynthia and her team were fantastic when my ring then had to be re-sized, and we just selected my beautiful wedding band to match. A wonderful experience all around, and a place that we will keep coming back to for years to come, for all our special occasions!

reviews.title: Great place to buy jewelery
text: The customer service is great, the selection is amazing...something for everyone, we were looking for an engagement ring and we found it! We chose a ring online and went to try it, but finally I tried something I would not have imagined and WOW:) It's mine now:) Really the selection is wonderful...I did notice they have a bit of everything and it's worth the trip.

reviews.title: The most pleasant ring-buying experience I could have imagined!
text: I went with my (now) fiancé to pick out a ring at Cynthia Findlay's. At first we were skeptical, because a lot of the photos online made it hard to tell what sort of selection she had in store. But the second we arrived, it was clear just how beautiful the rings were. The photos don't do them justice!

We were helped by Cynthia, and we were there for almost three hours, going through rings, narrowing it down. She was incredibly helpful at pulling rings from the collection that I might be interested, just by watching my response to other (similar) rings. This was so helpful, because it would have taken forever for me to go through them all myself. Once we had it narrowed down to the final three, she helped me try on different wedding band combos with each ring, so that I had an idea of what it would look like.

The bottle of champagne that comes with the ring was the final cherry on top! Such a lovely shopping experience. I will be recommending this shop to ANYONE looking for an antique or unique engagement ring.

reviews.title: Classy and friendly Service
text: Me and my girlfriend came in to shop for some vintage engagement rings. We looked at the online catalog and liked what we saw.
When we first arrived we were blown away with he size of the store and how much stuff they had in there. There was so much of a selection in there store it was almost over whelming.

But we were there for rings and they had the most helpful and friendliest staff. They also had a large selection of rings with most of them looking unique and vintage which was exactly what we were looking for. The prices seemed high but fairly fair for the type of ring we were looking for. I have my mind set on a type of ring which unfortunately they did not have, but would DEFINITELY recommended stopping in to look at the variety of rings and antiques they have.

reviews.title: Museum like
text: what a wonderful place to visit! Everything for every taste.
Staff friendly and so very helpful!
Will return again and again

reviews.title: Love this place!
text: Cynthia's store is one of best places to find unique and beautiful jewelry in Toronto. There are so many one of a kind pieces.  My husband found me a beautiful antique engagement ring at Cynthia's - he also found me a stunning sapphire anniversary ring - both of which I adore.
The staff are friendly and helpful - they do sizing quickly - we've had such a positive experience shopping here. Highly recommend checking it out.

reviews.title: Great selection but overpriced!
text: Checked this place out largely because of the positive Tripadvisor reviews, and it is fun to walk around in a gawk, but everything, and I do mean everything, in it is very overpriced.  If you're looking for that elusive piece to complete Gramma's china set, you can likely find it here, but you will pay much more than it is worth.

reviews.title: Outrageously over-priced
text: This shop has an impressive array of antiques as well as estate/ antiques/ resale jewelry. And the staff is very friendly.  I've been there a few times, once looking for a sterling silver thing for a birthday present, and at other times looking for jewelry for myself.

Unfortunately, the prices are outrageous.  For the silver thing that I was checking, the prices for silver-plate pieces are much much more expensive than solid sterling silver pieces that I can find elsewhere.

As for their estate/ antiques jewelry, again the prices are 2 - 3 times the prices of comparable, estate pieces that I can find at other shops in Toronto, or in Manhattan's famous Jewelry/ Diamond District (W 47th Street between 5th and 6th Avenues).  Whenever I buy a significant piece, I'd rather make a quick trip to New York, where you can find a much larger selection and a much more competitive market, and save thousands of dollars at least, plus you gain a nice getaway vacation.

To be honest I also find competitive prices on eBay, but you do need to be careful on eBay of course, and make sure you get your purchase certified by a professional jewelry appraiser when it arrives, as eBay guarantees a full refund (less shipping and import duties HST) if the item turns out to be fake, or materially different from what was advertised.
By all means go to this place to check it out, but make sure you know the prices before pulling out your wallet.

reviews.title: Great shop
text: Bought a classic engagement ring here, the staff was great and indulged my fiance in trying on every ring she wanted. They were super friendly and ended up giving us a bottle of champagne to celebrate. Really great experience.

reviews.title: Antique jewelry lovers paradise
text: This is by far the best and largest selection of well priced antique jewelry in North America. I look for antique jewelry in every city I travel to and was amazed, stunned, and overwhelmed by the selection in Cynthia's shop. I felt like a kid in a candy store. She is extremely knowledgeable and patient. I never felt pressured to buy anything and was given space to look at everything. Cynthia provides water bottles to keep clients from getting dehydrated while we inspect every inch of this fabulous shop. Her prices are very fair and I saw some one of a kind pieces that I now covet. With the exchange rate being favorable to the US dollar, there were quite a few bargains. I could fly to Toronto just to buy a piece of antique jewelry and the trip and purchase would cost far less than if I had gone to a comparable stateside dealer.
Don't get me started on her selection of antique China and porcelain.....Bravo.

reviews.title: Good Experience
text: Took some estate items to sell and had a great experience.  Cynthia was very knowledgeable, fair and pleasant to deal with. Our time was very efficient and we left happy campers.  The store is very impressive as well.

reviews.title: Engagement Ring and Custom Wedding Bands
text: What a great experience! I came to pick out my engagement ring with my sister, upon my fiancée's request (which I was very excited about). I picked 3, and they got them on record to let him know. It was like I was in a museum and the staff were so helpful, patient, and passionate. My partner came to pick one out, and I love it! This vintage blue sapphire ring.

We also got our wedding bands there, both custom designed. I designed (with the kind help of the staff) a very unique band of rose gold with tiny yellow sapphires to fit under my engagement ring. It came out better than I could have envisioned! My partner got his, and he also loves it.

Be aware that original quotes may change for custom designs, depending on various factors so try to keep track of that. As well, if you want a custom wedding band, give enough time (at least 1 month - though normally it takes 2 weeks) in case there are delays (in my case, it took a while to find the right colour of yellow sapphire!).
Honestly, it is all worthwhile - our rings are amazing!!!

reviews.title: Phenomenal Service and Products
text: We were amazed at the level of service provided by Cynthia. There was no pressure to buy anything; she took her time (I was at the shop 3x and brought my girlfriend with me the last time before we finally chose the item we wanted) and showed us a lot of different and amazing products. The diversity and beauty of her collection is truly outstanding, as is Cynthia herself - who is a real gem! I hope this experience brings me luck in my new relationship!!! Many thanks Cynthia...

reviews.title: Wonderful antique store
text: What a gem - huge antique store.  Lovely tableware and jewelry, wonderful staff, definitely worth a stop.

reviews.title: What a collection!
text: This was the only antique store I could find on my recent visit to downtown Toronto, but what a find it was.  Collectibles, fine jewelry, silver, dishes, china, figures, etc....there is so much packed into this second story shop.  Watch for the signs on the street just out front of the location.  It is clearly marked, but you do have to enter the business door and go up one flight of stairs to the store entrance.

I found the store's collection of antiques to be fascinating and very stunning to look at.  The amount of items packed into that location is incredible.  Just be careful not to bump anything as the outcome might be costly.  Hold backpack and purses close to you, especially when weaving in and out of the silver and china section.  Some very beautiful and stunning pieces.

I found the store personal to be quite friendly and helpful.  I was greeted as I entered the store and spent time talking with the store owner, who was most helpful in sharing about other antique fairs in the area.  I would definitely recommend stopping my Cynthia Findlay Antiques for those who are serious collectors of china, jewelry and exquisite silver collections.  I don't think you would be disappointed.
A most enjoyable visit indeed!!

reviews.title: An antique oasis
text: Antiques and collectables of every description.  It would take hours to go through it all.  My daughter got her wedding band there. I have bought silver baby cups.  There is literally everything old to be had.

reviews.title: Trust Cynthia Findlay with your Engagement Ring
text: To keep a long story short, I had trouble trusting just any jeweler with my diamond. I needed to make a custom band for my fiancee, but didn't know where to go. After some open source research, I found Cynthia Findlay online, read the reviews, and decided to meet her in person. Super professional and friendly, my fiancee and I entrusted her with our ring and it was the best decision we made. Cynthia Findlay is absolutely trustworthy and extremely knowledgeable with her craft. All costs are fair, timings are on point, and customer service is excellent.

Cynthia Findlay and her staff will allow you to keep peace of mind throughout the process, and all the stress was taken out of the equation. My fiancee loves her ring and cannot stop looking at it---in the end that's all that really matters anyway. Do yourself a favor and get your engagement ring done properly with Cynthia. You'll be glad you did.

reviews.title: Amazing service and great selection!!
text: Cynthia and her team were extremely helpful. They provided excellent customer service during every interaction I had with them. My situation was a bit unique as I lived overseas and my fiance lived out of town, and we were only going to be in Toronto for a couple of days. Cynthia and team spent hours on the phone patiently explaining and showing many engagement rings to me. They even provided express ring resizing and polishing so that everything was ready for me as soon as I arrived. Excellent customer service minded team that really took care of us. I highly recommend Cynthia Findlay for anyone looking to buy jewelry.

reviews.title: Gomez and Morticia Are Pleased
text: Vintage finery, charming atmosphere, knowledgeable staff ready to provide helpful assistance. Well done.

reviews.title: Excellent
text: My (now) fiancé and I came here randomly a year ago. I was googling antique stores in the neighbourhood, this came up, and so we paid a visit. After walking through the (huge) store, we ended up at the engagement rings. Cynthia talked to us for quite a while, telling us all we needed to know about diamonds. We ended up falling in love with a unique setting and came back the next day to buy it. She even took us outside with the ring and a loose diamond so we could see what it would eventually look like. A year later, we also got the diamond from Cynthia and I am absolutely in love with my ring! There was never any pressure from any of the staff to make a purchase and the whole experience was made so simple. Definitely recommend!

reviews.title: Exceptional Experience
text: I recently made a purchase at Cynthia Findlay Antiques. Cynthia personally assisted me in finding exactly what I was looking for. This required a lot of patience, as I was looking for a very unique ring. She was very knowledgeable, patient, professional and provided truly valuable advice. Being in the service industry myself, I can say with confidence that Cynthia Findlay offers a exceptional experience for anyone looking for antique jewelry/luxury items.

reviews.title: A fantastic ring buying experience,
text: I would recommend Cynthia to anyone looking for that perfect ring for their partner. When I went there the first time I hardly had a clue as to what it was that I was looking for. Even after researching into the 4 C's, and a lengthy discussion with my partner about the sort of ring that she wanted it's still a very daunting experience find the right ring for the person you want to spend the rest of your life with.

Cynthia was amazing, she personally took the time to hear me out and take the little information that I had in order to work out what would be best for us. She was patient and efficient and at no point during the several visits did I feel pressured into paying more than I could afford. She went out of her way to recommend that I take a look at the huge variety that she has online and I am so glad that she did. There are rings there for all budget ranges and I was able to go away, take the time to find 8 or 9 that I liked, share them with friends then go back and see them all. When I fell in love with the one I wanted and was sure it was right for me, Cynthia took the time to help me further realise the modifications I wanted to make, work with me to find out what ring size my partner was, and advise me on getting it appraised.

Between her and her assistant they really helped round out my confidence and isolate the PERFECT ring. The work I had done was excellent, the after care fantastic and the price was exactly as advertised with no hidden costs. More than that they made me confident in my choice and come the big day the look on my fiancé's face was priceless. This is the place to go for that once in a lifetime purchase. I was so happy that I have since returned with my partner so that we could thank her together and Cynthia even took the time to clean the ring for us again and showed us how to maintain it. Fantastic service and value, I can't recommend it highly enough.

reviews.title: Warm Friendly Service
text: Our dealing with Cynthia was so refreshing.  It is not often anymore that someone takes the time to get to know their customer.  Definitely a five star experience.

reviews.title: Treasures for Everyone
text: I came to the store with limited time (one day) to find treasures for our new home. There is truly something here for every budget and taste and it was hard to limit myself to just a few items!
In the end I ended up purchasing bronze owl book ends, a gold pitcher and a carafe with a silver duck's head. Each item was unique and something you definitely would not find in big box stores.

The staff was incredibly helpful in pointing out items that matched my taste. If you have only a short amount of time to go antiquing I would highly recommend this store! It is HUGE and you could easily spend hours here.

reviews.title: The Perfect Start To The Rest Of Your Life...
text: We began what we thought would be a long and difficult search for the perfect engagement ring at Cynthia's, imagining her wonderful establishment would be the first stop of many to come. Wrong.
We found the perfect ring and we could not be happier with the ring and the outstanding service provided by Cynthia and her Team.
Make sure you include Cynthia's on your list of go to places when it's time for you to ask the big question.

reviews.title: Recommended for engagement ring!
text: I can't say enough good things about Cynthia Findlay. I had a ring designed by a different designer and wasn't 100% pleased with the outcome, so I brought it to Cynthia. She spent lots of time going over different options and providing expert advise. I never felt pressure to make a decision or felt she was trying to make a sale. I ended up having a ring made through her designer that I absolutely love. My fiancé and I both ordered our wedding bands from her as well. Great customer service, excellent communication, and helpful and kind staff.

reviews.title: whiny man employee in the China area
text: a friend through social media referred me.  lovely lady employees in the front of the showroom.  as I moved my way to the back of the shop...
i saw a lady taking pix w/cell phone of items... so, i was going to just snap a wide shot of the shop showing how large the store was & text it to a friend.
I was immediately hissed at -
NO PHOTOGRAPHY ALLOWED by this tall man wearing glasses working in the back of the shop in the "granny" China section.
(meanwhile this lady nearby was snapping away photos on her cell phone...) he barked out to me, oh she's shooting for a magazine (really, with her cell phone?)

it's a big put off to be approached in such a manner with no visible signs posted where anyone could see no photos allowed. I was later told by a lady working in the front that the sign was posted on the front door (with a bunch of other signs and stickers... with a collage of things).
but I did notice later a paper sign laying FLAT on a table and another sign on laying on items on the floor -
no photos allowed.
great place for them... NOT

if it's so important that NO PHOTOS ALLOWED as this uptight employee was all upset about and then putting me off to the entire shop.  plus adding that they have so much valuable items blah blah blah as if I was ignorant.  I've shopped at The Louvre antique galleries & flea markets in Paris with all the photos I could take anyplace and all over the world as well and at auctions (just saying) & never being hissed or barked at by an employee then talked down to...  I've been in a few places that doesn't allow photos but signs were visibly posted!
if a visible sign is posted throughout the
store... this incident would have been avoided and Not been so turned off.
they do have a big inventory...
big. layers upon layers.  I've been known to buy lots, entire collections even.  it was like in pretty woman,
don't judge the way people look or to speak condescendingly to buyers.
your working in the store, we are buying.
rudeness is a big turn off.
I won't ever return or refer anyone to this "antique shop"

reviews.title: Stunning selection of antique jewellery!!!
text: My fiancé and I had the loveliest experience searching for our perfect   vintage engagement ring at Cynthia's store! She has a huge selection of stunningly beautiful, one of a kind pieces! The staff were extremely knowledgeable, patient and friendly. We had set out to see sapphire rings, with a particular style in mind. I had tried on nearly every beautiful ring that she had. Then Cynthia pulled out one that she had just received in that day. We couldn't believe it, but it was exactly what we had in mind and was without a doubt "the ring"! It was almost meant to be! We couldn't be happier with our choice and are so thrilled that we stumbled upon this wonderful store! You could literally spend days in Cynthia's store and be constantly in awe of her treasures.
We would absolutely recommend Cynthia Findlay's Antiques to anyone looking for something special and unique!
Chris, Michelle & baby Oliver :)

reviews.title: Recommended to anyone considering vintage jewellery
text: We had a great experience here. Before shopping, my only prerequisite for our rings was that they had to be vintage. Both Now Magazine and Blog T.O. listed Cynthia Findlay as a preferred option. We found an engagement ring and two wedding bands during a fun and relaxed visit, trying many to be certain we were happy with our selections. We arranged a deposit and a layaway. During the layaway period, we asked for photos, arranged for a new shank on the engagement ring, and then settled our account early to have the rings for Valentine's Day. All of these requests were handled by Cynthia in a quick and friendly manner.
We recommend Cynthia Findlay to anyone who's considering vintage jewellery.
